10:28 Caption: Angel Di Maria (Paris SG) reacts well to latch onto a rebound inside the box, but his shot is well blocked.
10:34 Caption: Marc-Andre ter Stegen makes a sensational save to thwart a great chance. A rebound falls to Adrien Rabiot (Paris SG) on the edge of the box and he strikes goalwards, but the ball ends up in the keeper's gloves instead of the middle of the goal.

17:49 Event: Direct free-kick by Paris SG
17:49 Event: Shots on target by Paris SG
17:50 Event: Goal by Paris SG
17:57 Caption: Angel Di Maria (Paris SG) smashes the ball from the resulting free kick and it sails into the top right corner. The goalkeeper merely turned his head. Absolutely amazing.
18:57 Event: Kick-off by Barcelona
21:06 Event: Shots on target by Paris SG

32:30 Event: Indirect free-kick by Paris SG

49:03 Caption: The referee checks his watch and blows his whistle to signal the end of this match.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
Paris Saint-Germain thrashed Barcelona 4-0 in an exhilarating match at Parc des Princes. The high-intensity Champions League clash saw PSG dominate both halves, with Angel Di Maria and Julian Draxler leading an impressive display.

The first half kicked off with PSG quickly establishing control. Right from the opening whistle, PSG looked sharp, and Barcelona seemed to struggle to keep up with their tempo. At 2:39, PSG committed a foul, which was swiftly followed by a yellow card at 2:43. Barcelona took their first indirect free-kick at 3:28 but failed to capitalize on this early opportunity. PSG's press soon led to their first shot on target at 5:13, followed by an off-target attempt.

As the teams jostled for control, the game saw a series of throw-ins and interruptions. By the 10th minute, PSG's attacking prowess began to show. Blaise Matuidi received a precise pass in the box and aimed for the middle of the goal, only to be denied by a fine save from Marc-Andre ter Stegen. The rebound fell to Angel Di Maria, but his shot was well blocked. Adrien Rabiot then struck goalwards from the edge of the box, but ter Stegen made another excellent save to keep the score level.

Barcelona were awarded another indirect free kick in the 12th minute following another PSG foul. Despite the opportunities, both sides couldn't break the deadlock, and the game witnessed several back-and-forth moments, including multiple throw-ins and goal attempts. At 17:49, however, PSG made a breakthrough. Angel Di Maria smashed a direct free kick into the top right corner, leaving ter Stegen helpless and sending Parc des Princes into wild celebrations.

Barcelona attempted to respond immediately as Edinson Cavani's shot was saved yet again by ter Stegen. Luis Suarez's solo run a minute later earned Barcelona a corner, although Neymar's delivery wasn’t able to find any teammates. PSG continued their resolute defense by blocking Andre Gomes' low drive, and Rabiot managed a crucial clearance.

The first half took a decisive turn for PSG at the 39th minute when Marco Verratti set up Julian Draxler. Showing great determination, Draxler got to the ball inside the box and fired it into the left side of the net, making it 2-0. Despite Barcelona’s efforts to regain their footing, including a Messi shot attempt that failed to breach PSG's defense, PSG closed the first half with a solid 2-goal advantage.

The second half set off with renewed vigor, both teams eager to shape the game’s outcome. However, Barcelona faltered early with fouls, including a handball by Sergi Roberto, giving PSG the chance to bolster their lead. Within the first 10 minutes, PSG struck again with a stunning drive from Angel Di Maria. Receiving a pass around the edge of the box, Di Maria blasted the ball from medium range into the top left corner, making no mistake and firmly placing PSG in a commanding 3-0 lead.

Barcelona's coach reacted with substitutions, bringing on Rafinha for Andre Gomes. However, PSG capitalized on their dominance with defensive solidity and fluid transitions. By the 26th minute, Edinson Cavani further confirmed PSG’s supremacy. Thomas Meunier played a pivotal role here, delivering a precise pass which Cavani latched onto inside the box. Showing great determination to outpace the defenders, Cavani found the right corner, and PSG’s lead ballooned to an unprecedented 4-0.

Barcelona, clearly on the back foot, couldn’t match PSG’s overwhelming prowess. Various attempts from the Catalan giants to get on the score sheet, including Neymar efforts, Rakitic’s mids, and inaccurate shots either hit the post or were expertly cleared by PSG's defense. Neymar whipped in several set pieces, but Barcelona was unable to capitalize on these opportunities. Umtiti’s header off a lofted pass hit the post, further exemplifying Barcelona’s growing frustration.

Late substitutions from both sides aimed to manage the tempo and freshness on the field. PSG’s introduction of Christopher Nkunku and Javier Pastore maintained their momentum. Jordi Alba and Neymar's aggressive plays resulted in several fouls, indicative of their desperation and frustration against PSG’s unyielding defense. Despite PSG conceding a few free kicks from fouls, Barcelona couldn’t translate these into goals.

As the match wound down, PSG comfortably retained possession, making strategic throw-ins and maintaining tight control over the game's pace. Barcelona's attempts to find at least a consolation goal were thwarted by PSG's well-disciplined defense, with tactical clearances and blocks culminating in protecting their clean sheet.

The final whistle ultimately confirmed a colossal 4-0 victory for Paris Saint-Germain. PSG exhibited a spectacular blend of attacking flair and defensive stability, overpowering Barcelona, who seemed uncharacteristically out of sorts and disorganized. Key performances from Di Maria, Cavani, and Draxler combined with solid defensive efforts, proved vital in delivering one of PSG's most memorable European nights.

This result not only bolstered PSG’s confidence but also sent ripples through the footballing world, demonstrating that PSG were serious contenders in the Champions League. For Barcelona, this heavy defeat laid bare the gaps they needed to address, raising questions about their tactics and game management in high-pressure away games. In the grand theater of European football, this match registered as a resounding statement from Paris Saint-Germain, one that their ambitions were as high-flying and blazing as the goals they scored that night.
